intro: Memecylon fosteri, commonly known as the African waterleaf, is a tropical shrub native to Central and East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. Memecylon fosteri is adapted to wet, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or riverine habitats.
